greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(1) = 0, f(n) = -1 if n is an even number > 2, and f(n) = A323234(n) for odd numbers >= 3.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
xref: Cf. also A323242 (somewhat analogous filter sequence for prime factorization).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 08 2019
